description: From Arabic قَافِلَة‎ (qāfila, “caravan”). Doublet of cafila.

entries.meaning: A line of people or animals fastened together, especially a chain of prisoners or slaves.
examples: If the explorer could make Kamalia he might be able to hook up with a slave coffle heading for the coast.

verbs.description: coffle (third-person singular simple present coffles, present participle coffling, simple past and past participle coffled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fasten (a line of people or animals) together.
